intro: Eriosyce sandillon var. algarrobensis, commonly known as the Algarrobón cactus, is a species of flowering cactus native to Argentina. It belongs to the Cactaceae family and is characterized by its compact, globular shape and spiny stems. The plant produces yellow flowers during the warmer months, typically in spring. It is adapted to arid environments and requires minimal water, making it suitable for xerophytic gardens. Its unique appearance and resilience make it a notable species in its native habitat.
